Criterion Text In:
FOR DOSE ESCALATION COHORTS ONLY: Pathologically confirmed breast cancer with the following features:
* Measurable disease by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1
* Estrogen receptor (ER) and progesterone receptor (PR) =< 1% by immunohistochemistry
* Her-2/neu negative (0 or 1+ by immunohistochemistry OR not amplified by College of American Pathologists/American Society of Clinical Oncology [CAP/ASCO] standards)
* Metastatic or unresectable and locally advanced and not amenable to treatment with curative intent, in the opinion of the enrolling investigator OR
* Platinum-resistant (defined as progression within 12 months of last platinum therapy administration), pathologically confirmed serous ovarian cancer that is recurrent and unresectable, in the opinion of the enrolling investigator
Criterion Text Out:
FOR DOSE ESCALATION COHORTS ONLY: Pathologically confirmed breast cancer with the following features:
* Measurable disease by Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST) 1.1
* Estrogen receptor (ER) and progesterone receptor (PR) =< 1% by immunohistochemistry
* Her-2/neu negative (0 or 1+ by immunohistochemistry OR not amplified by College of American Pathologists/American Society of Clinical Oncology [CAP/ASCO] standards)
* Metastatic or unresectable and locally advanced and not amenable to treatment with curative intent, in the opinion of the enrolling investigator OR
* Platinum-resistant (defined as progression within 12 months of last platinum therapy administration), pathologically confirmed serous ovarian cancer that is recurrent and unresectable, in the opinion of the enrolling investigator
Criterion Rule: Disease is "Breast Cancer" AND ER is False AND PR is False AND Her-2/neu is False

Criterion Text In:
FOR DOSE EXPANSION COHORT ONLY: Pathologically confirmed breast cancer with the following features:
* Measurable disease by RECIST 1.1
* ER and PR =< 1% by immunohistochemistry
* Her-2/neu negative (0 or 1+ by immunohistochemistry OR not amplified by CAP/ASCO standards)
* Metastatic or unresectable and locally advanced and not amenable to treatment with curative intent, in the opinion of the enrolling investigator
Criterion Text Out:
FOR DOSE EXPANSION COHORT ONLY: Pathologically confirmed breast cancer with the following features:
* Measurable disease by RECIST 1.1
* ER and PR =< 1% by immunohistochemistry
* Her-2/neu negative (0 or 1+ by immunohistochemistry OR not amplified by CAP/ASCO standards)
* Metastatic or unresectable and locally advanced and not amenable to treatment with curative intent, in the opinion of the enrolling investigator
Criterion Rule: Disease is "Breast cancer" AND ER <= 1% is True AND PR <= 1% is True AND HER2 is False

Criterion Text In: FOR ALL PATIENTS:
Criterion Text Out: FOR ALL PATIENTS
Criterion Rule: "FOR ALL PATIENTS" is True

Criterion Text In: Age >= 18
Criterion Text Out: Age >= 18
Criterion Rule: age >= 18

Criterion Text In: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status =< 2
Criterion Text Out: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status =< 2
Criterion Rule: Performance Status is less than or equal to 2

Criterion Text In: Able to swallow pills
Criterion Text Out: Able to swallow pills
Criterion Rule: none

Criterion Text In: Absolute neutrophil count > 1,500/mcL
Criterion Text Out: Absolute neutrophil count > 1,500/mcL

Criterion Text In: Platelets > 100,000/mm^3
Criterion Text Out: Platelets > 100,000/mm^3
Criterion Rule: Platelets > 100000

Criterion Text In: Hemoglobin > 9 g/dL
Criterion Text Out: Hemoglobin > 9 g/dL
Criterion Rule: Hb > 9

Criterion Text In: Serum bilirubin levels =< 1.5 mg/dL. Higher levels are acceptable if these can be attributed to active hemolysis or ineffective erythropoiesis. Bilirubin above 1.5 mg/dL due to Gilbertâ€™s is still excluded
Criterion Text Out: Serum bilirubin levels =< 1.5 mg/dL. Higher levels are acceptable if these can be attributed to active hemolysis or ineffective erythropoiesis. Bilirubin above 1.5 mg/dL due to Gilbertâ€™s is still excluded
Criterion Rule: serum bilirubin levels <= 1.5 AND (bilirubin > 1.5 AND Gilbert's)

Criterion Text In:
Serum aspartate transaminase (AST) and serum alanine transaminase (ALT) =< 2.5 x upper limit of normal
* AST (serum glutamic-oxaloacetic transaminase [SGOT])/ALT (serum glutamate pyruvate transaminase [SGPT]) =< 5 x institutional upper limit of normal (ULN) for patients with liver metastasis
Criterion Text Out: Serum aspartate transaminase (AST) and serum alanine transaminase (ALT) =< 2.5 x upper limit of normal
Criterion Rule: SGOT <= 2.5 * ULN, SGPT <= 5 * ULN

Criterion Text In: Alkaline phosphatase < 2.5 x upper limit of normal, unless bone metastasis is present in the absence of liver metastasis
Criterion Text Out: Alkaline phosphatase < 2.5 x upper limit of normal, unless bone metastasis is present in the absence of liver metastasis
Disease: Alkaline Phosphatase, Bone Metastasis, Liver Metastasis
Criterion Rule: ALP < 2.5 * ULN, BM == False && LM == False

Criterion Text In: Serum creatinine levels =< 1.5 mg/dL
Criterion Text Out: Serum creatinine levels =< 1.5 mg/dL
Criterion Rule: CREATININE <= 1.5

Criterion Text In:
Patient must have the following laboratory values within normal limits or corrected to within normal limits with supplements before the first dose of study medication:
* Potassium
* Magnesium
* Total calcium (corrected for serum albumin)
Criterion Text Out: Patient must have the following laboratory values within normal limits or corrected to within normal limits with supplements before the first dose of study medication:
Criterion Rule: "Potassium", "Magnesium", "Total calcium (corrected for serum albumin)" is True

Criterion Text In: International normalized ratio (INR) =< 1.5 (unless the patient is receiving anticoagulants and the INR is within the therapeutic range of intended use for that anticoagulant within 7 days prior to the first dose of study drug)
Criterion Text Out: International normalized ratio (INR) =< 1.5

Criterion Text In: Presence of >= 1 metastatic sites of disease that can be safely accessed for core needle biopsy and patient willingness to undergo fresh tissue biopsies of up to 3 lesions. (Safely accessible means risk of mortality or major morbidity < 1.5%, such as core needle biopsy of breast, superficial lymph node, subcutaneous nodule, peripheral liver nodule, pleural nodule, omental nodule, etc. or per investigator discretion)
Criterion Text Out: Presence of >= 1 metastatic sites of disease that can be safely accessed for core needle biopsy and patient willingness to undergo fresh tissue biopsies of up to 3 lesions.
Procedure: Core Needle Biopsy, Fresh Tissue Biopsy
Criterion Rule: METASTASIS > 0 AND SAFELY ACCESSIBLE > 0

Criterion Text In: Negative serum or urine pregnancy test at screening for women of childbearing potential
Criterion Text Out: Negative serum or urine pregnancy test at screening for women of childbearing potential
Criterion Rule: Disease is None

Criterion Text In: Agrees to continue use of approved birth control for at least 6 months after receiving the last dose of study drugs
Criterion Text Out: Agrees to continue use of approved birth control for at least 6 months after receiving the last dose of study drugs
Criterion Rule: Agrees to continue use of approved birth control for at least 6 months after receiving the last dose of study drugs

Criterion Text In: Able to provide informed consent and have signed an approved consent form that conforms to federal and institutional guidelines
Criterion Text Out: Able to provide informed consent and have signed an approved consent form that conforms to federal and institutional guidelines
Criterion Rule: able_to_provide_informed_consent_and_have_signed_an_approved_consent_form_that_conforms_to_federal_and_institutional_guidelines

Criterion Text In: Previous use of CDK 4/6 or HDAC inhibitors for cancer treatment
Criterion Text Out: Previous use of CDK 4/6 or HDAC inhibitors for cancer treatment
Criterion Rule: PREVIOUS_USE_OF_CDK4_OR_HDAC == True, PREVIOUS_USE_OF_CDK4_OR_HDAC == True

Criterion Text In: Major surgery, radiotherapy, anticancer therapy, or investigational agents =< 4 weeks of treatment day 1 or =< 5 half-lives, whichever is shorter
Criterion Text Out: Major surgery, radiotherapy, anticancer therapy, or investigational agents =< 4 weeks of treatment day 1 or =< 5 half-lives, whichever is shorter
Criterion Rule: "Major surgery, radiotherapy, anticancer therapy, or investigational agents" <="4 weeks of treatment day 1" OR "Major surgery, radiotherapy, anticancer therapy, or investigational agents" <="5 half-lives"

Criterion Text In: Patients with new or progressive brain metastases (active brain metastases) or leptomeningeal disease unless determined by the treating physician that immediate central nervous system (CNS) specific treatment is not required and is unlikely to be required during the first cycle of therapy
Criterion Text Out: Patients with new or progressive brain metastases (active brain metastases) or leptomeningeal disease unless determined by the treating physician that immediate central nervous system (CNS) specific treatment is not required and is unlikely to be required during the first cycle of therapy
Criterion Rule: "Brain Metastasis" OR "Leptomeningeal Disease" is True AND ("Immediate CNS Specific Treatment" is False OR "Treating Physician Determined")

Criterion Text In: Medical condition that in the opinion of the enrolling investigator would require the use of valproic acid within =< 5 days of the first dose of belinostat or while on study
Criterion Text Out: Medical condition that in the opinion of the enrolling investigator would require the use of valproic acid within =< 5 days of the first dose of belinostat or while on study
Criterion Rule: "Valproic Acid" is True

Criterion Text In: Active infection requiring systemic therapy
Criterion Text Out: Active infection requiring systemic therapy
Criterion Rule: LK INF == True, INF == True

Criterion Text In: History of allergy or hypersensitivity to belinostat, ribociclib, or their binders
Criterion Text Out: History of allergy or hypersensitivity to belinostat, ribociclib, or their binders
Criterion Rule: "Belinostat", "Ribociclib", "Allergy", "Hypersensitivity" are all False

Criterion Text In: Uncontrolled arrhythmia, congestive heart failure or angina. Patients who have had a myocardial infarction, symptomatic pericarditis, or cardiac surgery should be at least 6 months from the event and free of active symptoms
Criterion Text Out: Uncontrolled arrhythmia, congestive heart failure or angina. Patients who have had a myocardial infarction, symptomatic pericarditis, or cardiac surgery should be at least 6 months from the event and free of active symptoms
Criterion Rule: "Uncontrolled arrhythmia", "congestive heart failure", "angina", "myocardial infarction", "pericarditis", "cardiac surgery" is False

Criterion Text In: Known left ventricular ejection fraction < 50%. (Echocardiogram is not required for study entry)
Criterion Text Out: Known left ventricular ejection fraction < 50%. (Echocardiogram is not required for study entry)
Criterion Rule: "Known left ventricular ejection fraction < 50%" is False

Criterion Text In: Clinically significant cardiac arrhythmias (e.g., ventricular tachycardia), complete left bundle branch block, high grade atrioventricular (AV) block (e.g., bifascicular block, Mobitz type II and third degree AV block)
Criterion Text Out: Clinically significant cardiac arrhythmias (e.g., ventricular tachycardia), complete left bundle branch block, high grade atrioventricular (AV) block (e.g., bifascicular block, Mobitz type II and third degree AV block)
Criterion Rule: "Clinically significant cardiac arrhythmias (e.g., ventricular tachycardia), complete left bundle branch block, high grade atrioventricular (AV) block (e.g., bifascicular block, Mobitz type II and third degree AV block)" is False

Criterion Text In: Congenital long QT syndrome
Criterion Text Out: Congenital Long QT Syndrome
Criterion Rule: LQTS == True

Criterion Text In: Baseline corrected QT interval (QTcF) > 450 msec. The heart rate on the qualifying electrocardiogram (ECG) must be between 50 and 90 beats per minute (BPM)
Criterion Text Out: Baseline corrected QT interval (QTcF) > 450 msec. The heart rate on the qualifying electrocardiogram (ECG) must be between 50 and 90 beats per minute (BPM)
Criterion Rule: QTcF > 450 AND HeartRate BETWEEN 50 AND 90

Criterion Text In: Concurrent use of medication known to inhibit UGT1A1. Patients currently taking these medications must have discontinued >= 7 days prior to treatment day 1
Criterion Text Out: Concurrent use of medication known to inhibit UGT1A1. Patients currently taking these medications must have discontinued >= 7 days prior to treatment day 1
Criterion Rule: "Medication known to inhibit UGT1A1" is False

Criterion Text In: Concurrent use of herbal supplements, unless approved by the principal investigator. Patients currently taking herbal supplements must have discontinued >= 7 days prior to treatment day 1
Criterion Text Out: Concurrent use of herbal supplements, unless approved by the principal investigator. Patients currently taking herbal supplements must have discontinued >= 7 days prior to treatment day 1
Criterion Rule: "Herbal Supplement" is False or "Herbal Supplement" is True and "DaysSinceLastUse" is GreaterThan 7

Criterion Text In: Concurrent use of medication with a known risk of inducing torsades de pointes (on the known risk list of crediblemeds.org) that cannot be discontinued or switched to a different medication >= 7 days prior to starting the study drug
Criterion Text Out: Concurrent use of medication with a known risk of inducing torsades de pointes (on the known risk list of crediblemeds.org) that cannot be discontinued or switched to a different medication >= 7 days prior to starting the study drug
Criterion Rule: "Torsades De Pointes" is True AND "Medication" is True AND "Discontinued" is False AND "Switched" is False

Criterion Text In: Unresolved diarrhea >= grade 2, per Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version (v)5.0
Criterion Text Out: Unresolved diarrhea >= grade 2, per Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version (v)5.0
Criterion Rule: "Unresolved diarrhea >= grade 2, per Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (CTCAE) version (v)5.0" is True

Criterion Text In:
Use of any of the following substances =< 7 days prior to the start of the treatment:
* Known strong and moderate inducers or inhibitors of CYP3A4/5, including grapefruit, grapefruit hybrids, pomelos, star-fruit, and Seville oranges
* Medications that have a narrow therapeutic window and are predominantly metabolized through CYP3A4/5. Examples include certain benzodiazepines such as alprazolam and anti-seizure medications such as carbamazepine. Ultimately determination of drugs with a narrow therapeutic window is left to the discretion of the principal investigator
Criterion Text Out: Use of any of the following substances =< 7 days prior to the start of the treatment
Criterion Rule: <(use_of_any_of_the_following_substances) >< (7_days_prior_to_start_of_treatment) >

Criterion Text In: Patient is currently receiving warfarin or other coumarin derived anti-coagulant, for treatment, prophylaxis or otherwise. Note: Therapy with heparin, low molecular weight heparin (LMWH), an oral factor Xa inhibitor, an oral direct thrombin inhibitor, or fondaparinux is allowed
Criterion Text Out: Patient is currently receiving warfarin or other coumarin derived anti-coagulant, for treatment, prophylaxis or otherwise. Note: Therapy with heparin, low molecular weight heparin (LMWH), an oral factor Xa inhibitor, an oral direct thrombin inhibitor, or fondaparinux is allowed
Disease: Warfarin, Coumarins, Heparin, Low Molecular Weight Heparin, Oral Factor Xa Inhibitors, Oral Direct Thrombin Inhibitors, Fondaparinux
Criterion Rule: PT_WARFARIN == True OR PT_COUMARIN == True OR PT_HEPARIN == True OR PT_LMWH == True OR PT_Oral_FXa_Inhibitor == True OR PT_Oral_Direct_Thrombin_Inhibitor == True OR PT_Fondaparinux == True

Criterion Text In: Impaired gastrointestinal (GI) function that may alter absorption of medicines, such as uncontrolled inflammatory bowel disease, uncontrolled vomiting, or major stomach or small bowel resection
Criterion Text Out: Impaired gastrointestinal (GI) function that may alter absorption of medicines, such as uncontrolled inflammatory bowel disease, uncontrolled vomiting, or major stomach or small bowel resection
Criterion Rule: "Impaired gastrointestinal (GI) function that may alter absorption of medicines, such as uncontrolled inflammatory bowel disease, uncontrolled vomiting, or major stomach or small bowel resection" is True

Criterion Text In: Pregnant or breast feeding
Criterion Text Out: Pregnant or breast feeding
Criterion Rule: Disease is "Pregnancy"

Criterion Text In:
Women of child-bearing potential defined as all women physiologically capable of becoming pregnant or men whose female partner is of child-bearing potential, unless they are using highly effective methods of contraception during the study treatment and for 6 months after stopping the treatment. Highly effective contraception methods include:
* Total abstinence (when this is in line with the preferred and usual lifestyle of the patient. Periodic abstinence (e.g., calendar, ovulation, symptothermal, post-ovulation methods) and withdrawal are not acceptable methods of contraception
* Female sterilization (have had surgical bilateral oophorectomy with or without hysterectomy), total hysterectomy or tubal ligation at least 6 weeks before taking study treatment. In case of oophorectomy alone, only when the reproductive status of the woman has been confirmed by follow up hormone level assessment
* Male partner sterilization (at least 6 months prior to screening). For female patients on the study, the vasectomized male partner should be the sole partner for that patient and the success of the vasectomy must be medically confirmed as per local practice
* Placement of an intrauterine device (IUD)
* Use of hormonal contraception plus a barrier contraceptive
Criterion Text Out:
Women of child-bearing potential defined as all women physiologically capable of becoming pregnant or men whose female partner is of child-bearing potential, unless they are using highly effective methods of contraception during the study treatment and for 6 months after stopping the treatment. Highly effective contraception methods include:
* Total abstinence (when this is in line with the preferred and usual lifestyle of the patient. Periodic abstinence (e.g., calendar, ovulation, symptothermal, post-ovulation methods) and withdrawal are not acceptable methods of contraception
* Female sterilization (have had surgical bilateral oophorectomy with or without hysterectomy), total hysterectomy or tubal ligation at least 6 weeks before taking study treatment. In case of oophorectomy alone, only when the reproductive status of the woman has been confirmed by follow up hormone level assessment
* Male partner sterilization (at least 6 months prior to screening). For female patients on the study, the vasectomized male partner should be the sole partner for that patient and the success of the vasectomy must be medically confirmed as per local practice
* Placement of an intrauterine device (IUD)
* Use of hormonal contraception plus a barrier contraceptive
Criterion Rule: Disease is "Women of child-bearing potential" AND Hormonal contraception is True OR Barrier contraception is True

Criterion Text In: Known human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection with a detectable viral load within 6 months of the anticipated start of treatment. Note: Patients on effective anti-retroviral therapy with an undetectable viral load within 6 months of the anticipated start of treatment are eligible for this trial
Criterion Text Out: known human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection with a detectable viral load within 6 months of the anticipated start of treatment
Criterion Rule: "HIV" is True and "Viral Load" is GreaterThan(0)

Criterion Text In: Known chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) or hepatitis C virus infection with a detectable viral load. Note: Patients with an undetectable HBV viral load on appropriate suppressive therapy are eligible. Patients with an undetectable HCV viral load are eligible
Criterion Text Out: Known chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) or hepatitis C virus infection with a detectable viral load. Note: Patients with an undetectable HBV viral load on appropriate suppressive therapy are eligible. Patients with an undetectable HCV viral load are eligible
Disease: Hepatitis B Virus Infection, Hepatitis C Virus Infection
Criterion Rule: HBV == True OR HCV == True

Criterion Text In: Malignancy other than breast carcinoma or ovarian cancer (dose escalation) anticipated to need systemic treatment within 1 year in the opinion of the enrolling investigator
Criterion Text Out: Malignancy other than breast carcinoma or ovarian cancer (dose escalation) anticipated to need systemic treatment within 1 year in the opinion of the enrolling investigator
Disease: Malignancy other than breast carcinoma or ovarian cancer
Criterion Rule: Disease is "Malignancy other than breast carcinoma or ovarian cancer"
